articles.headline: Didi’s Regulatory Troubles Might Just Be Getting Started
articles.snippet: After Beijing removed it from app stores over data concerns, the newly listed ride-hailing platform could face further scrutiny in China — and in the United States.
articles.abstract: After Beijing removed it from app stores over data concerns, the newly listed ride-hailing platform could face further scrutiny in China — and in the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the paperwork Didi filed before its initial public offering, the Chinese ride-hailing platform gave no shortage of warnings to investors that regulators in Beijing were hovering.
articles.byline: By Raymond Zhong and Peter Eavis

articles.headline: Haiti’s President Assassinated in Nighttime Raid, Shaking a Fragile Nation
articles.snippet: A group of assailants stormed Mr. Moïse’s residence early on Wednesday, shooting him and wounding his wife. The interim prime minister declared a “state of siege.”
articles.abstract: A group of assailants stormed Mr. Moïse’s residence early on Wednesday, shooting him and wounding his wife. The interim prime minister declared a “state of siege.”
articles.lead_paragraph: The first explosions rang out after 1 a.m., shattering the calm in the neighborhood that was home to President Jovenel Moïse and many of Haiti’s most affluent citizens.
articles.byline: By Catherine Porter, Michael Crowley and Constant Méheut

articles.headline: Ireland’s Days as a Tax Haven May Be Ending, but Not Without a Fight
articles.snippet: For decades, multinationals moved to Ireland for its low taxes. A new global tax plan has put Dublin on the defensive.
articles.abstract: For decades, multinationals moved to Ireland for its low taxes. A new global tax plan has put Dublin on the defensive.
articles.lead_paragraph: On the crowded waterside quay of Dublin’s Silicon Docks neighborhood, Google’s European headquarters tower above the skyline. Facebook and Twitter are neighbors. The European bases of Apple, Pfizer and hundreds of U.S. multinationals are implanted around the country, symbols of the commerce produced by Ireland’s famously low corporate taxes.

articles.headline: Mark Zuckerberg and Sheryl Sandberg’s Partnership Did Not Survive Trump
articles.snippet: The company they built is wildly successful. But her Washington wisdom didn’t hold up, and neither did their close working relationship.
articles.abstract: The company they built is wildly successful. But her Washington wisdom didn’t hold up, and neither did their close working relationship.
articles.lead_paragraph: Sheryl Sandberg knew she’d be asked about the attacks on the Capitol.
articles.byline: By Sheera Frenkel and Cecilia Kang

articles.headline: In Michigan, Pro-Impeachment Republicans Face Voters’ Wrath
articles.snippet: Representative Peter Meijer, a Republican who voted to impeach Donald J. Trump, seeks “decency and humility” in Western Michigan, but has found anger, fear and misinformation.
articles.abstract: Representative Peter Meijer, a Republican who voted to impeach Donald J. Trump, seeks “decency and humility” in Western Michigan, but has found anger, fear and misinformation.
articles.lead_paragraph: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich. — Representative Peter Meijer cites Gerald R. Ford as his inspiration these days, not because the former president held his House seat for 24 years or because his name is all over Grand Rapids — from its airport to its freeway to its arena — but because the freshman congressman sees virtues in Ford now lost to his political party.

articles.headline: ‘Who Are Our Enemies?’ China’s Bitter Youths Embrace Mao.
articles.snippet: The chairman’s call for struggle and violence against capitalists is winning over a new audience of young people frustrated with long work hours and dwindling opportunities.
articles.abstract: The chairman’s call for struggle and violence against capitalists is winning over a new audience of young people frustrated with long work hours and dwindling opportunities.
articles.lead_paragraph: They read him in libraries and on subways. They organized online book clubs devoted to his works. They uploaded hours of audio and video, spreading the gospel of his revolutionary thinking.
